StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SavePersonnel]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @PersonnelID uniqueiden..er, @OrgUnitID int, @PersonID uniqueiden..er, @UserID uniqueiden..er, @BilletID int, @RankID int ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT PersonnelID FROM [dbo].[Personnel] WHERE [PersonnelID] = @PersonnelID) BEGIN UPDATE [dbo].[Personnel] SET [OrgUnitID] = @OrgUnitID, [PersonID] = @PersonID, [UserID] = @UserID, [BilletID] = @BilletID, [RankID] = @RankID WHERE [PersonnelID] = @PersonnelID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [dbo].[Personnel] ( [PersonnelID], [OrgUnitID], [PersonID], [UserID], [BilletID], [RankID] ) VALUES ( @PersonnelID, @OrgUnitID, @PersonID, @UserID, @BilletID, @RankID )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
